channel.title: Powerminer/autominer array help
channel.description:
hi, ive made a powerminer/autominer, but ive wrote out every procedure to min each rock, and i need help with using arrays so i dont have 8 procedures all the mine different rocks??
sorry if you dont understand me, i kinda dont understand myself!!
ive look at the tuts, but they dont give examples with using arrays with automining procedures!!
a little tut would be very appreciated, or you could just talk me through it... thanks!!

item.title: Powerminer/autominer array help
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

It goes to the top corner and clicks because you have a find color function that searches for a color then outputs those coords to two variables you specify. When this color is not found it sets the coords to 0, 0.

Read full topic

It’s probably a line that calls MMouse or Mouse with strange coordinates, not sure, never had problems with that. Try closing and reopening the script.

item.title: Powerminer/autominer array help
item.dc:creator: @hello_to_you_all hello to you all
item.description:
@hello_to_you_all wrote:

its still coming with same problem… and the mouse goes off to the top left corner of the rs screen as does nothing else

i allready had SetupSRL; there

this is what it looks like…

Begin
ClearDebug;
SRLRandomsReport;
LoadColors;
LoadBitmaps;
ActivateClient;
SetupSRL;
SetupSRLMining;
ModSetRun(True);
FindPickHeadColor;
Repeat
CanWeFindRocks;
MineRock;
ProgressReport;
DropOres;
FindNormalRandoms;
AntiRandoms;
DropOres;
ProgressReport;
Until(Loads = LoadsToDo)
End.

Read full topic

item.title: Powerminer/autominer array help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Take out the MineClay; MineTin; and MineCopper; and put MineRock; after CanWeFindRocks;

Read full topic

item.title: Powerminer/autominer array help
item.dc:creator: @hello_to_you_all hello to you all
item.description:
@hello_to_you_all wrote:

one more thing… at the end of scripts theres always like a list saying:

[scar]
Begin
ClearDebug;
SRLRandomsReport;
LoadColors;
LoadBitmaps;
ActivateClient;
SetupSRL;
SetupSRLMining;
Repeat
CanWeFindRocks;
MineClay;
MineTin;
ProgressReport;
DropOres;
FindNormalRandoms;
MineCopper;
until (Loads = LoadsToDo)
[/scar]

whats it all about and where do i put the new things i got from you in here?

item.title: Powerminer/autominer array help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Same way, just with a integer in the case statement:

[SCAR] case Rock of
1 : RockColor := ClayColor;
2 : RockColor := TinColor;
3 : RockColor := CopperColor;
etc…
[/SCAR]

Read full topic

const
Rock = 1;//1-Clay 2-Tin 3-Copper 4-Iron 5-Gold 6-Mithril 7-Addy 9-Rune
[/scar]

so how would that work?

Read full topic

item.title: Powerminer/autominer array help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I think what you’re looking for is this:

[SCAR]
const
RockType = ‘Iron’; //User specifies which rock to mine.

var
ClayColor, TinColor, CopperColor, IronColor: Integer;//Delcare some vars to hold colors.
RockColor: Integer;//Use this to load the appropriate rock color into

procedure LoadOreColors;
begin
ClayColor := 838022; //Load some colors into the Color variables
TinColor := 119302;
CopperCollor := 16771942;
IronColor := 55203;
end;

procedure SetRockColor;
begin
Case RockType of //Depending on what the user put for RockType, do one of the following
‘Clay’ : RockColor := ClayColor; //Load the right color into RockColor
‘Tin’ : RockColor := TinColor;
‘Copper’ : RockColor := CopperColor;
‘Iron’ : RockColor := IronColor;
else
begin
WriteLn(‘Invalid RockType.’);
TerminateScript;
end;
end;
end;[/SCAR]

Then, using that, you would only need one mining procedure, like this:

[SCAR]procedure MineRock;
begin
if FindColorSpiralTolerance(x, y, RockColor, 1, 1, 515, 338, 5) then
begin
//Mining procedure stuff in here…
end;
end;[/SCAR]

I hope I helped,

-Weibs.

Read full topic
